    "tags": ["bizz", "software3"],

    "start_date": "2020-08-22",
    "end_date": "2021-09-27",
    "No_professional": "353",
    "expected_working_hours": "15",
    "skills": "python, react, node js, vs code",

    "price_budget": "$1000/hr",
    "req_prof_criteria": "good communication skills"
}

request.description:
API to create a project.

NOTE: only a company user can create a project

# **API For Paginating projects(Company/Professional)** API to to paginate Projects with filters that you can apply. Here are some general use cases and how to use the api. 1. Getting all projects in general: 1. To do this just send the api with the size and page parameter. So if you want to get the first page just do size:(whatever size you want) and page: 2. You can add additional filters such as status and tags if you want to 2. Getting a Projects Tied to a specific company 1. To get a projects tied to a specific company you can just turn on the companyId 2. You can add more filters as you want 3. Getting a project tied to a user 1. To see projects where the user has applied or joined just add the userId filter 2. To see projects where the user is an applicant, use the userId filter with userStatus field set to pending 3. To see projects where the user is already joined then set the userId filter with userStatus set to joined 4. To see projects where the user is currently an invited applicants then set the userId filter with userStatus set to invited IMPORTANT: Filters can be used together with each other ## Request Type: json Request Format | | required | type | description | example | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | companyId | false | text | company user account id used to filter projects belonging to a specific company | "6535e61b2684b34926774d98" | | size | true | number | The size of the pagination you want to get | 4 | | page | true | number | The page of the pagination you want to fetch (Starts from 1) | 1 | | tags | false | Array | Array of text that represents the tags you want to use as a filter | \[tag1,tag2\] | | status | false | Array of stirng where value is
Either new or ongoing or completed | Status filter if you want to filter projects that is new , ongoing or completed | \["new", "ongoing"\] | | userId | false (true if you also use the userStatus filter) | text | professional user account id used to filter projects where the professionaluser is part of the project | | | userStatus | false | Either joined or pending | Can be used to filter projects for a specific professsional user where they have applied to the project or where they have joined the projecet | | | sortBy | false | text in the format of
"sortKey sortOrder" | Used to sort the projects based on either their startDate or endDate ascendingly or descendingly

Valid sortKey:
\-startDate
\-endDate

Valid sortOrder:
\-asc
\-desc | To sort by start date ascendingly:
startDate asc

to Sort by start date descendingly
startDate desc

to sort by end date ascendingly:
endDate asc

to sort by end date descendingly:
endDate desc | ## Response Type: json Response for both Professional user and company user | Field Name | type | description | example | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | projectsList | Array | An Array of Documents representing the project. Each Object also contains an owner o | Can see from the examples | | owner | Object | An object inside eahc project object inside the projects list.
The owner object represents the owner of the project or the company account that owns the project.
The owner object contain the owner account id and username | | | amountOfProjects | number | Number of total users projects on the filter given in the api | | | size | number | the size of each pagination page | | | totalPages | number | The total number of pages available based on the pagination filters that is provided | | | currentPage | number | The current page number in the pagination | | | hasPrevPage | boolean | Just ignore this one | | | hasNextPage | boolean | Just ignore this one | | | prevPage | number | null | The number of the previous page of this pagination result. Will be null if there is no prevPage | | nextPage | number | null | The number of the next page of this pagination result, will be null if there is no nextPage |

request.description: API to view a specific project detail

API to update project status to completed or ongoing

NOTE:

\-default value for status is new when project is first created

\-only the creator of the project can call this API

API to request to join a project.

NOTE:

- This will append the user into the potential applicants field in the project details
- Only professional user can call this
- Professional user will receive confirmation email if their request to join is received succesfully
    
- API will automatically accepts applicant who were invited directly into the project

request.description:
API for company user to approve ,reject, or remove a professional that has requested to join or has been approved to be in the project.

NOTE:

- Only the creator of the project can approve, reject, or remove professional users
    
- This will essentially move the user to a field called approved applicants field in the project details if a user is approved. If the user is rejected, this will just remove the user from the potential applicant field.
- This API also automatically sends approval/rejection letter to the professional user.

API to view the approved professional users for a specific project

NOTE:

- Only a company user (e.g. must be the creator of the project) can call this api

API for company user to invite a professional to join their project. This is done by sending an email to the professional user while also providing a link for them to join the project.

The body for this request takes in:

- professionalEmail: the email of who you want to invite
- projectId: project id that professional user will be invited to
- link: the link of the project that you want to invite the professional user to
    

NOTEL:

- Only the creator of the project can invite professional users to join their project

request.description:
# **API For Deleting a Project**

## **IMPORTANT: THIS API REQUIRES THE JWT TOKEN IN THE AUTHORIZATION HEADER**

Api to Delete a project.

A project can only be deleted by the owner of the project and the admin.

Additionaly, This API will also recursively delete all reviews related to the project.

## Request Type: json

## Response Type: json

Succesfull Deletewill return a 200 OK Request

# **API For Paginating Reviews for a Project**

API to to paginate Reviews that is correlated to a completed project (Project with status of completed)

## Request Type: json

Request Params:

id: the project id in which you want to retrieve the reviews from

Request Format

|  | required | type | description | example |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| size | true | number | The size of the pagination you want to get | 4 |
| page | true | number | The page of the pagination you want to fetch (Starts from 1) | 1 |

## Response Type: json

Response for both Professional user and company user

| Field Name | type | description | example |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| reviewsList | Array | An Array of Documents representing the reviews. | Can see from the examples |
| amountOfReviews | number | Number of Reviews available for the project specified |  |
| size | number | the size of each pagination page |  |
| totalPages | number | The total number of pages available based on the pagination filters that is provided |  |
| currentPage | number | The current page number in the pagination |  |
| hasPrevPage | boolean | Just ignore this one |  |
| hasNextPage | boolean | Just ignore this one |  |
| prevPage | number | null | The number of the previous page of this pagination result. Will be null if there is no prevPage |
| nextPage | number | null | The number of the next page of this pagination result, will be null if there is no nextPage |

response.name: Get Reviews
